abstract: Omar Abdullah, chief minister of Indian-controlled state of Jammu and Kashmir, says that the situation in many areas of Kashmir is peaceful enough to warrant revoking much-despised Armed Forces Special Powers Act, which suspends basic civil rights and shields security forces from prosecution in Kashmir.
snippet: Officials said Kashmir is peaceful enough to warrant removing the Armed Forces Special Powers Act, which suspends basic rights and shields security forces.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

lead_paragraph: Officials said Kashmir is peaceful enough to warrant removing the Armed Forces Special Powers Act, which suspends basic rights and shields security forces.

headline.main: Kashmir to Lift Reviled Security Law
headline.print_headline: Indian Portion Of Kashmir Plans to Lift Security Law
headline.seo: Kashmir to Lift Reviled Security Law
